meanings.definition: Metallises (verb): to coat or treat with metal
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith metallises the sword to make it stronger.
meanings.sent2: She metallises the jewelry to give it a shiny finish.
meanings.sent3: The robot metallises everything it touches, turning them into metal.
meanings.sent4: His determination metallises his resolve, making him unstoppable.
meanings.sent5: The sun's heat metallises the sand into glass sculptures.

meanings.definition: Metallises (noun): the process of applying a metal coating
meanings.sent1: The metallises of the car parts ensure they are rust-resistant.
meanings.sent2: The metallises of the building protect it from harsh weather.
meanings.sent3: The factory's metallises are so efficient that they finish work in half the time.
meanings.sent4: The artist's metallises give the sculptures a unique shine.
meanings.sent5: The metallises of the spaceship make it durable for space travel.

meanings.definition: Metallises (adjective): having a metal coating or treatment
meanings.sent1: The metallises surface of the gate gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The metallises finish on the car made it stand out on the road.
meanings.sent3: The robot had a metallises exterior that made it look futuristic.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a metallises quality that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The armor's metallises appearance made the knight look invincible.
